APPENDIX L 
Research Participation Consent Form 
 
THE IMPACT OF RESISTANCE TRAINING WITH AFRICAN AMERICAN 
PERIMENOPAUSE WOMEN IN SAN ANTONIO 
 
Principal Investigator: Letesha Butler 
Liberty University 
School of Health Science 
 
You are invited to participate in a research study. 
To be a part of the study, participants meet the following criteria: 
• African American woman 
• Over the age of 40 
• BMI greater than 30 kg/m2 
• Had a menstrual cycle in the past 11 months 
• Have experienced at least four of the following symptoms: irregular periods, hot 
flashes, weight gain, poor sleep, vaginal dryness, mood swings, brain fog, or 
bladder problems 
Things you should know: 
• The purpose of my research is to investigate how resistance training impacts body fat in 
obese African American perimenopausal women in San Antonio, Texas. If you choose to 
participate you will be asked to have a body composition analysis conducted with the 
primary investigator, InBody 270, and participate in workout groups with the researcher’s 
team two times a week for six weeks. Each workout session will take 30 minutes to 
complete. 
 
• Risks or discomforts from this research include muscle soreness, fatigue, joint pain, and 
breathing difficulties. 
 
• Benefits from this study are that it reduces stress and anxiety, improves mood, enhances 
cognitive function, promotes better sleep, reduces risk of chronic diseases, and increases 
longevity. 
 
• Taking part in this research project is voluntary. You do not have to participate, and you 
can stop at any time. 
 
Please read this entire form and ask questions before deciding whether to participate in this 
research. 
 
The purpose of this study is to investigate how resistance training impacts body fat in obese 
African American perimenopausal women in San Antonio, Texas. 
 

255 
 
 
 
You are invited to participate in a research study. To participate, you must be an African 
American woman over the age of 40 with a BMI greater than 30 kg/m2. As well have had a 
menstrual cycle in the past 11 months, and have experienced at least four of the following 
symptoms: irregular periods, hot flashes, weight gain, poor sleep, vaginal dryness, mood swings, 
brain fog, or bladder problems. 
 
If you agree to be in this study, I will ask you to do the following: 
1. Schedule an InBody 270 body composition analysis at Newsom Fitness that will take no 
more than 10 minutes. 
2. You will be randomly assigned to a group by pulling the group's name from a jar. 
3. You will receive a workout schedule for your assigned group, which will meet twice 
weekly. Depending on the group assignment, you can attend in-person sessions or virtual 
sessions. Each session will last 30 minutes 
4. You are asked not to do any resistance training unless with your assigned group. 
5. After the last workout session, you will need to schedule another InBody 270 body 
composition analysis at Newsom Fitness. 
 
The direct benefits participants should expect from participating in this study include reduction 
of stress and anxiety, improved mood, enhanced cognitive function, better sleep, reduced risk of 
chronic diseases, and increased longevity. 
The expected risks from participating in this study are minimal, which means they are equal to 
the risks you would encounter in everyday life. The risks involved in this study include muscle 
soreness, fatigue, joint pain, and breathing difficulties. 
Confidentiality: The records of this study will be kept private. Published reports will not include 
any information that will make it possible to identify a subject. Research records will be stored 
securely, and only the researcher will have access to the records. 
 
• Participant responses will be kept confidential by replacing names with numbers. 
• Confidentiality cannot be guaranteed in focus group settings. While discouraged, other 
focus group members may share what was discussed with persons outside of the group. 
• Data collected from you may be used in future research studies or shared with other 
researchers. If data collected from you is reused or shared, any information that could 
identify you will be removed beforehand. 
• Data will be stored in a locked filing cabinet. The researcher will have access to the data. 
After three years all electronic records will be deleted and hard copies will be shredded. 
 
Participants will be compensated for participating in the study. After the first InBody 270 
analysis, participants will receive free shipping on the first order from the researcher’s meal prep 
services, Newsom Fit Meals. After completing all study procedures, participants will receive a 
25% discount on any personal training services from the researcher’s gym, Newsom Fitness. 
Participation in this study is voluntary. Your decision whether to participate will not affect your 
current or future relations with Liberty University. If you decide to participate, you are free not 
to answer any question or withdraw at any time without affecting those relationships. 
 

256 
 
 
 
If you choose to withdraw from the study, please contact the researcher at the email 
address/phone number in the next paragraph. Should you withdraw, data collected from you will 
be destroyed immediately and not included in this study. 
Letesha Butler, lnnewsome@liberty.edu, 571-659-8418. 
 
The researcher conducting this study is Letesha Butler. You may ask any questions you have 
now. If you have questions later, you are encouraged to contact her at lnnewsome@liberty.edu, 
571-659-8418. 
If you have any questions or concerns regarding this study and want to talk to someone other 
than the researcher, you are encouraged to contact the IRB. Our physical address is Institutional 
Review Board, 1971 University Blvd., Green Hall Ste. 2845, Lynchburg, VA, 24515; our phone 
number is 434-592-5530, and our email address is irb@liberty.edu. 
 
Disclaimer: The Institutional Review Board (IRB) ensures that human subjects research will be 
conducted ethically as defined and required by federal regulations. The topics covered and 
viewpoints expressed or alluded to by student and faculty researchers are those of the 
researchers and do not necessarily reflect the official policies or positions of Liberty University. 
 
By signing this document, you are agreeing to be in this study. Make sure you understand what 
the study is about before you sign. You will be given a copy of this document for your records. 
The researcher will keep a copy with the study records. If you have any questions about the study 
after you sign this document, you can contact the study team using the information provided 
above.
